page.title: 01GENERAL BLOCK REVIEW
page.content: The block is,in the main,gently undulating.It is effectively bordered to the north by the M.20.motorway,to the west by the Ashford Industrial Estate,to the south by the scarp slope of the downs and to the east by Saltwood Village.There are five main housing areas,Saltwood,Lympne,Pedlinge Newingreen and Westenhanger.The great majority of employed people work outside the area. It is an area of mixed farming and parkland with a large area of mixed woodland in the south-east corner.There is no industrial development and the main feature of the area is the Folkestone Racecourse. There is evidence of occupation of the area from pre-roman times to the present day.
